articles.title: Pereira Must Vacate‚Ä¶Tom, Not So Fast
articles.description: Alex Pereira may need to vacate his belt‚Ä¶ but Tom Aspinall isn‚Äôt going to make that easy. There‚Äôs a growing theory that Pereira could move to heavyweight ‚Äî possibly for the White House mega-card. And if he does, history tells us one thing: champions don‚Äôt change divisions for non-title fights. If Pereira goes up, it‚Äôs for gold. So what happens to Tom? Reports surfaced claiming Aspinall was asked to vacate. Some called it a troll account. But in MMA, stories rarely appear out of thin air. There‚Äôs usually smoke. The real question isn‚Äôt whether Tom gets stripped ‚Äî it‚Äôs whether the UFC creates an interim heavyweight belt to set up something bigger. Pereira vs Ciryl Gane? An undisputed unification later? There‚Äôs leverage here. There‚Äôs timing here. And there‚Äôs only so many title fights you can stack on a White House card before reality sets in. Let‚Äôs break down what‚Äôs possible, what‚Äôs politics, and what makes business sense. Subscribe for daily UFC breakdowns and fight-business insight. #UFC #AlexPereira #TomAspinall #Heavyweight #WhiteHouseCard #MMA 0:00 Pereira Must Vacate? 0:40 The Troll Report 1:30 Why Champions Don‚Äôt Move for Nothing 2:20 Interim Title Scenario 3:40 Protecting Tom‚Äôs Position 4:50 White House Card Timing 6:00 Pereira at Heavyweight 7:15 What Actually Makes Sense Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Dricus, Stop Telling the Truth!
articles.description: Dricus du Plessis, listen carefully ‚Äî stop telling the truth about your fight with Khamzat Chimaev. That fight was dominant. Historically dominant. And every time DDP reminds us of it, he hurts himself. Nick Diaz once lost every round to Anderson Silva‚Ä¶ then grabbed the mic and told the world he won all five. The crowd exploded. His stock rose. Why? Because perception beats history. Dricus keeps calling the fight boring. He keeps explaining what happened. He keeps validating Chimaev. That doesn‚Äôt help him. New fans are coming in every day. New networks. New audiences. The past only exists if you keep reminding people. Max Holloway got stuck in the Volkanovski vortex. Dricus doesn‚Äôt have to. This is about positioning. This is about narrative. This is about star power. Stop advertising losses. Subscribe for daily UFC analysis and fight psychology breakdowns. #UFC #DricusDuPlessis #KhamzatChimaev #MMA 0:00 Dricus, Listen Carefully 0:45 The Max Holloway Example 1:40 One of the Most Dominant Title Fights Ever 3:00 The Scott Hall Story 4:10 Nick Diaz Psychology Lesson 5:10 Don‚Äôt Advertise Losses 6:20 New Fans, New Narrative 7:15 Why This Matters Now Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Is Ilia Topuria Actually That Good? #ufc
articles.description: Description (SEO-optimized, high-retention, ~180‚Äì240 words) Is Ilia Topuria really as good as the hype ‚Äî or are we all getting carried away? When you ask fighters who actually understand the sport at the highest level, the answer gets very clear, very fast. Top names like Chris Weidman, Dustin Poirier, Laura Sanko, Dean Thomas, Aljamain Sterling, and Michael Chandler were all asked the same thing: Have we seen enough? The response was unanimous ‚Äî yes. Yes, he caught Alexander Volkanovski with power. Yes, he finished Charles Oliveira early. But the bigger takeaway is consistency, confidence, and composure under pressure. Even with elite contenders like Arman Tsarukyan sitting cageside and watching the division shift, there‚Äôs growing belief that Topuria is operating at a different level right now. The real question isn‚Äôt power ‚Äî it‚Äôs sustainability. Can he do it for 20+ minutes? Can anyone drag him somewhere uncomfortable? So far, inside the Ultimate Fighting Championship, nobody has shown a complete skill set that clearly breaks him. Watch more fight breakdowns, predictions, and insider MMA analysis. #UFC #MMA #IliaTopuria #UFCLightweight #UFCFeatherweight #MMANews #FightBreakdown #CombatSports

articles.title: Did We All Misjudge Tom Aspinall? #ufc
articles.description: The story around Tom Aspinall may have just completely flipped. What once looked like weakness now looks like real damage ‚Äî and maybe a misunderstanding that went way too far. New images showing Aspinall undergoing double eye surgery change the entire conversation. At the time of the incident, there were loud narratives questioning toughness and suggesting he wanted out. But according to officials, no rule was technically broken during the sequence. The referee did not call a disqualification. Still, if damage was caused ‚Äî intentional or not ‚Äî the bigger question becomes competitive fairness. If a fighter is injured in a sequence that ends a fight, should the opponent automatically get a rematch opportunity? That debate is now front and center around the heavyweight division and the matchmaking decisions inside the Ultimate Fighting Championship. The conversation also circles back to how quickly fans judge fighters at the elite level. Heavyweight margins are razor thin. One moment can change a career, a title run, or public perception. If anything, this situation reinforces how brutal championship MMA really is ‚Äî and how fast narratives can age badly. If the division moves forward with potential rematches or new challengers like Ciryl Gane in the mix, the stakes only get bigger. But right now, the biggest shift is simple: the idea that Aspinall quit is getting harder and harder to defend. Watch for more heavyweight news, matchup breakdowns, and fight predictions. #UFC #MMA #TomAspinall #UFCHeavyweight #CirylGane #FightNews #MMANews #UFCRankings #CombatSports

articles.title: Is UFC Heavyweight Division the Worst It‚Äôs Ever Been?
articles.description: Is the UFC heavyweight division the worst it‚Äôs ever been? That‚Äôs the narrative right now. But is it true? From Tom Aspinall‚Äôs injury questions to Gable Steveson‚Äôs potential debut, to why light heavyweights like Aleksandar Rakiƒá should seriously consider moving up ‚Äî this episode of Ask Uncle Chael tackles the myth surrounding heavyweight. Here‚Äôs the uncomfortable truth: the bigger you go, the easier it gets. We‚Äôve seen it before. Randy Couture. Daniel Cormier. Mark Coleman. Even Alex Pereira could realistically capture a heavyweight title if he moves up. The idea that heavyweight is the ‚Äúhardest‚Äù division is perception ‚Äî not reality. There‚Äôs less depth. Less iron-on-iron. More opportunity. And if that offends you, good. Plus: ‚Äì Is Conor vs Nate 3 realistic for the White House card?‚Äì Is Aspinall milking the eye injury?‚Äì Does wrestling dominance deserve 10-8s for cardio drain? #UFC #Heavyweight #TomAspinall #GableSteveson #MMA 0:00 Conor vs Nate 3 at the White House? 1:20 Is Heavyweight Really That Bad? 2:50 Does Aspinall‚Äôs Injury Make Sense? 4:10 Does the Division Need Gable? 6:00 Advice on Winning & Losing 8:40 10-8 Wrestling Debate 10:00 Why Light Heavyweights Should Move Up Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Ian Garry Next for Islam?
articles.description: Ian Machado Garry might get the next title shot against Islam Makhachev ‚Äî at least according to Michael Bisping. But is this real momentum‚Ä¶ or just a slow news cycle? Garry‚Äôs r√©sum√© is strong. He pushed Shavkat Rakhmonov to the limit, beat former champion Belal Muhammad, and handled rising contenders like Carlos Prates and Geoff Neal. You can‚Äôt deny his trajectory. His stock rose even in defeat. But here‚Äôs the real question: if Garry isn‚Äôt next, then who is? There‚Äôs Michael Morales, who may or may not have been told he‚Äôs next after Madison Square Garden. There‚Äôs Kamaru Usman, who silenced doubts about his knees and reminded everyone what championship-level looks like. Stylistically, Usman vs Islam makes immediate sense. Yet no one at 170 is aggressively calling for Islam. And that‚Äôs the real issue. In a division short on star power, Garry and Colby Covington are the only true headline-makers. Garry is still improving ‚Äî an outlier in a sport where most veterans plateau. If you don‚Äôt give Garry the shot now, where do you put him? And if you don‚Äôt give it to Usman, when does his clock run out? Let me know who should face Islam next. #UFC #IanGarry #IslamMakhachev #KamaruUsman #UFC170 0:00 Slow News or Real Shot? 1:30 Morales vs Garry Debate 3:00 Why I Want Usman 4:20 Garry Is Getting Better 5:30 The 170 Star Problem 6:45 Who Should Fight Islam? Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: ‚ÄúHow You KO‚Äôd Moraes?‚Äù DJ Teaches Arman His Flying Knee
Dricus Just Made a Big Mistake
articles.description: Dricus du Plessis says he‚Äôs ready to fight Khamzat Chimaev. The problem? That fight isn‚Äôt happening. And when a former champion resurfaces after being oddly quiet, this is the moment to control the narrative. Instead, DDP used words like ‚Äúobviously‚Äù and ‚Äúlike I said‚Äù ‚Äî and neither helps his position. There is nothing obvious about wanting to fight Chimaev. If anything, the optics say the opposite. More importantly, there‚Äôs no realistic scenario where the UFC books Dricus vs Chimaev next. DDP built his career by steering the ship. He demanded main card placement over Bo Nickal. He parlayed momentum into Robert Whittaker. Then into Sean Strickland. Then into a championship. That wasn‚Äôt luck. That was strategy. Right now, Dricus is in the most dangerous position in MMA ‚Äî contender without a plan. If you don‚Äôt call your shot, the UFC will call it for you. And you won‚Äôt like their version as much as your own. If DDP wants his belt back, he needs to name the path. #UFC #DricusDuPlessis #KhamzatChimaev #Middleweight #MMA 0:00 Dricus Missed Here 1:10 Why ‚ÄúObviously‚Äù Is a Problem 2:00 The Chimaev Reality 3:00 How DDP Built His Rise 4:45 The Danger of Not Calling Your Shot 6:00 What He Should Do Next Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: ‚ÄúDESTROYING the DIVISION?!‚Äù | Strickland Says He's Only One Who Beats Khamzat | BISPING REACTS
articles.description: Khamzat hasn‚Äôt fought since August 2025, and Sean Strickland is calling him out hard. Strickland says he‚Äôs the only man who can beat Khamzat Chimaev and even claims ‚ÄúFluffy‚Äù Hernandez is a better wrestler than Chimaev. Khamzat Chimaev is undefeated, a dominant force at middleweight, and now looks like his cardio issues are solved after going five rounds. If Chimaev fights next, it should be Nassourdine Imavov ‚Äî unless the winner of Sean Strickland vs Brendan ‚ÄúFluffy‚Äù Hernandez jumps the line. Strickland talks, Chimaev dominates, and Dricus Du Plessis needs to defend the UFC middleweight title soon. Middleweight just got interesting again. üîí Become a Member for special Perks, Exclusive Content and ultra-exclusive Live Chats: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrG2_1TcVkXKXXsD6Kjwig/join ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Follow Michael on Social: https://www.instagram.com/mikebisping https://www.twitter.com/bisping https://www.facebook.com/mikethecountbisping ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Edited by John Brannigan: https://www.instagram.com/johnbranniganuk https://www.twitter.com/johnbranniganuk #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #khamzatchimaev

articles.title: ‚Äú1, 2, 3‚Ä¶ GO‚Äù Third Belt Incoming? | Is Alex Pereira Fighting at Heavyweight?
articles.description: Alex Pereira tweeted ‚Äú1, 2, 3‚Ä¶ go.‚Äù That sounds like one thing ‚Äî a third UFC title. Alex Pereira is already a two division champion, former middleweight champion and light heavyweight champion. With Tom Aspinall recovering and Jon Jones likely retired, the UFC heavyweight title picture is wide open. If Tom Aspinall is sidelined, Alex Pereira vs Ciryl Gane for an interim UFC heavyweight title makes sense. Alex Pereira chasing a third belt would be historic. Is Alex Pereira about to fight for the UFC heavyweight championship? üîí Become a Member for special Perks, Exclusive Content and ultra-exclusive Live Chats: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrG2_1TcVkXKXXsD6Kjwig/join ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Follow Michael on Social: https://www.instagram.com/mikebisping https://www.twitter.com/bisping https://www.facebook.com/mikethecountbisping ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Edited by John Brannigan: https://www.instagram.com/johnbranniganuk https://www.twitter.com/johnbranniganuk #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #alexpereira #jonjones #tomaspinall #cirylgane

articles.title: Aspinall Asked to Vacate?!
articles.description: Tom Aspinall has reportedly been asked to vacate the UFC heavyweight championship ‚Äî but is there truth behind the rumor? After a claim surfaced online and was later labeled a troll post, the story gained traction when Josh Thomson discussed it publicly. Now the bigger question isn‚Äôt whether Tom is being stripped‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs whether the White House card changes everything. If Alex Pereira moves to heavyweight, does he fight Ciryl Gane? And if so, is there a belt attached? History tells us one thing: sitting UFC champions do not change weight classes unless a championship is on the line. Never just for ‚Äúa fight.‚Äù That opens the door to a potential interim heavyweight title ‚Äî not as punishment to Aspinall, but as a way to keep the division moving while Tom heals from an injury suffered inside the cage under illegal circumstances. With Pereira openly discussing heavyweight and never mentioning a light heavyweight defense, speculation is rising fast. The clock is ticking on White House announcements. #UFC #TomAspinall #AlexPereira #Heavyweight #whitehousecard 0:00 Aspinall Vacate Rumor Explained 1:25 Pereira to Heavyweight? 2:40 Why an Interim Belt Makes Sense 4:05 The White House Card Clue 5:40 What This Means for Tom Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Daniel Cormier on Joaquin Buckley & Shakur Stevenson UFC-boxing BEEF, MVP's DISAPPOINTING next fight
articles.description: Daniel Cormier IS BACK to react to Joaquin Buckley and Shakur Stevenson having their PUBLIC BEEF between boxing and the UFC. DC takes Buckley's side, despite their differences in the past. Cormier says he's ALL FOR BUCKLEY talking smack to Stevenson, because today's boxing is NOWHERE NEAR the level of the UFC. Plus, DC gets into Michael Venom Page's next fight against Sam Patterson, going in on why this fight is so strange and unnecessary for MVP's career path in the UFC. articles.description: THE LEGEND GILBERT MELENDEZ IS HERE! articles.title: If This Card Happens‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs Massive #ufc
articles.description: There‚Äôs real smoke right now around a potential super card ‚Äî and if this comes together, it‚Äôs built around activity, star power, and guaranteed violence. The most likely headliner? Ilia Topuria vs Justin Gaethje. That‚Äôs action you can sell globally. Pressure vs precision. Durability vs finishing instinct. It feels like the kind of fight that headlines itself. Then you start stacking the card‚Ä¶ If he‚Äôs unbooked, it‚Äôs very easy to imagine Alex Pereira getting placed in a co-main or feature spot. Few fighters bring instant main-event gravity the way he does. The guy I‚Äôm most confident shows up on this type of card? Michael Chandler. Activity matters. Readiness matters. Chandler has built a reputation on both. Very strong chance you also see Sean O'Malley somewhere on the lineup. He moves numbers. He brings eyeballs. That matters for cards like this. There‚Äôs also noise around Colby Covington vs Bo Nickal. If that gets announced, it instantly becomes one of the most talked-about fights on the entire event. As for Conor McGregor‚Ä¶ momentum feels slower. Not impossible. Just not something you build a card around right now. But if you walk out of a meeting with Topuria headlining and Pereira on the same card under the Ultimate Fighting Championship banner‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs a statement event. That‚Äôs the kind of card fans remember. #UFC #MMA #IliaTopuria #JustinGaethje #AlexPereira #MichaelChandler #SeanOMalley #ColbyCovington #BoNickal #ConorMcGregor

articles.title: Cleanest vs Greatest ‚Äî Not The Same #ufc
articles.description: If you‚Äôre talking about style, domination, and overwhelming pressure, that was the era of Khabib Nurmagomedov. One style. But it was a style nobody could stop. But here‚Äôs the real question nobody asks the right way‚Ä¶ Does the greatest fighter of all time need to be the cleanest athlete of all time? Because that‚Äôs where the conversation changes. If your son had to step into a cage tomorrow, and you could give him the complete skill set of one fighter ever ‚Äî striking, grappling, fight IQ, creativity, adaptability ‚Äî are you honestly not picking Jon Jones? Cleanest athlete ever? That‚Äôs a different list. Greatest fighter ever? That‚Äôs a different debate entirely. Every era of combat sports has gray areas. Rules evolve. Testing evolves. What never changes is what happens when the cage door shuts. Championships. Longevity. Solving every style put in front of you. Jon‚Äôs career forces a hard conversation: are we judging greatness by perfection outside the cage‚Ä¶ or dominance and skill inside it? You don‚Äôt have to like the answer. But you do have to decide which question you‚Äôre actually asking. Subscribe for real UFC debate, fight breakdowns, and GOAT conversations people avoid. #UFC #JonJones #Khabib #MMA #GOAT #UFCDebate #FightTalk #CombatSports #UFCHistory #MMAAnalysis

articles.title: 'KHABIB WARNS TOPURIA!?' | Makhachev CALLS OUT Ilia for WHITE HOUSE!? | BISPING REACTS
articles.description: Sorry Gaethje‚Ä¶ If the UFC is building the biggest White House event in history, there‚Äôs no bigger fight than Islam Makhachev vs Ilia Topuria. Islam Makhachev vs Ilia Topuria is two prime, two division champions colliding in a true superfight. Yes, Justin Gaethje deserves his lightweight title shot, but Islam Makhachev vs Ilia Topuria is once in a lifetime. Islam Makhachev brings the size, wrestling, grappling and championship r√©sum√©. Ilia Topuria brings elite boxing and knockout power. Critics doubt Ilia Topuria against Islam Makhachev, but Ilia Topuria has finished champions in two divisions. Wrestling favors Islam Makhachev, striking favors Ilia Topuria. If the UFC wants the biggest possible fight for the White House card, Islam Makhachev vs Ilia Topuria is the fight to make, even if Justin Gaethje has to wait. üîí Become a Member for special Perks, Exclusive Content and ultra-exclusive Live Chats: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrG2_1TcVkXKXXsD6Kjwig/join #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #iliatopuria #islammakhachev

articles.title: The Move That Saved Aspinall‚Äôs Career
articles.description: Tom Aspinall made a decision months ago that now looks incredibly smart ‚Äî he refused to tie his career to Jon Jones. When Tom Aspinall was pursuing the undisputed heavyweight title, he made one thing clear: he wanted the championship, not a specific opponent. He was willing to fight Jon Jones, but he wasn‚Äôt going to wait around for him.The heavyweight division is moving on. And Tom Aspinall never chained himself to a fight that may never happen. articles.title: Mike Perry Got Jumped at a Bare Knuckle Event
articles.description: Mike Perry and Eddie Alvarez were at the same bare knuckle event ‚Äî and things escalated quickly. In this breakdown, Chael Sonnen explains what happened between Mike Perry and the crew around Eddie Alvarez. According to Perry‚Äôs version, an exchange with Alvarez‚Äôs son and his girlfriend turned provocative, tempers flared, and within seconds the situation spiraled. At some point Perry went down ‚Äî whether from a push, a slip, or a stumble ‚Äî and that‚Äôs when multiple people swarmed him. It looked chaotic, messy, and like something that could‚Äôve turned into a major legal issue. But here‚Äôs the twist: Perry isn‚Äôt upset. After speaking directly with Perry, Chael shares that Perry took responsibility for his role in the situation. He admitted he was drinking, admitted it was heated, and didn‚Äôt seem interested in escalating it further. No lawsuit talk. No revenge narrative. Just, ‚ÄúWe were at a fight. Things got rowdy.‚Äù Given the history between Perry and Alvarez from their bare knuckle fight, maybe this wasn‚Äôt entirely surprising. Still, it‚Äôs one of the wildest off-cage moments of the weekend. articles.title: Sean O‚ÄôMalley Is Playing This Perfectly...
articles.description: Sean O‚ÄôMalley might have just made the smartest callout of the year. After back surgery, Petr Yan is rumored to be lining up a fight with Merab Dvalishvili ‚Äî but O‚ÄôMalley stepped in with a different idea. His pitch? Don‚Äôt fight the guy who beat me. Fight me. I‚Äôm the easier fight. Only Sean O'Malley could sell that without threats, profanity, or theatrics. It was pure strategy. Merab is a relentless, grinding nightmare. O‚ÄôMalley is offering a high-profile rematch with controversy already baked in. Let‚Äôs not forget ‚Äî Yan vs O‚ÄôMalley the first time was razor close and heavily debated. Add two more rounds to make it a five-round fight, and suddenly the story changes completely. Different pacing. Different conditioning. Different outcome potential. There‚Äôs also unfinished business. Yan has a loss to O‚ÄôMalley on his record. Against Merab, he already holds a win. So what‚Äôs the smarter move if you‚Äôre coming off surgery? This ultimately comes down to what the fans want. The UFC historically rewards fighters who show up and do favors. Merab has done that. But O‚ÄôMalley just made a compelling case. So what‚Äôs the bigger fight ‚Äî Yan vs Merab, or Yan vs O‚ÄôMalley 2? Let me know in the comments. #UFC #SeanOMalley #PetrYan #MerabDvalishvili #Bantamweight #MMA Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: I Was Wrong About the White House Card
articles.description: I might have been wrong about the White House card. When the idea first surfaced, I believed it would be a standard UFC event ‚Äî big, yes, but structured like UFC 100, 200, 300, Madison Square Garden, or Sphere. A title fight on top, maybe another in the co-main, and that‚Äôs it. But then two important pieces of information came out. First, Jon Anik suggested we could see as many as seven title fights. When Jon speaks about the future, you listen. Second, Ari Emanuel said the White House card may only feature six or seven fights total. That changes the math entirely. If the event only has six or seven fights, each one likely stretches longer ‚Äî possibly five-round championship bouts. Add in the fact that no UFC title fights are currently booked, and suddenly the detective work starts to make sense. Could Islam Makhachev, Ilia Topuria, Alex Pereira, or even a heavyweight rematch find their way onto that stage? I don‚Äôt have inside information. But when the matchmakers meet and everyone wants on that card, something special is coming. I may have to change my mind ‚Äî and that doesn‚Äôt happen often. Subscribe for more UFC analysis and fight business insight. #UFC #WhiteHouseCard #JonAnik #AriEmanuel #MMA #FightBusiness Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: Jon Jones‚Äô Exit Plan? DC Isn‚Äôt Buying It...
articles.description: Daniel Cormier doesn‚Äôt believe Jon Jones ‚Äî and this time, it‚Äôs not about rivalry. It‚Äôs about retirement. In this breakdown, Chael Sonnen reacts to comments from Daniel Cormier regarding Jon Jones and his recent statements about needing a hip replacement. Jones claimed he has arthritis, can‚Äôt wrestle properly, and wants to preserve what‚Äôs left of his body for his family. Later, he suggested he didn‚Äôt know he was being recorded when those comments surfaced. Cormier pushed back. Not because of the recording ‚Äî but because he believes Jon is subconsciously coming to terms with being finished. According to DC, this isn‚Äôt about meta glasses or narrative control. It‚Äôs about a fighter realizing the ‚Äúcar‚Äù isn‚Äôt the same anymore. Chael reflects on that moment every fighter eventually faces ‚Äî when training stops feeling automatic and retirement becomes real for the first time. He compares it to noticing every flaw in a car the moment you start thinking about replacing it. The problems were always there ‚Äî but now you see them differently. The question isn‚Äôt whether Jon can still win. It‚Äôs whether he still wants the life that comes with it. And if DC is right, that answer may already be decided.
